text: The Copy SOP is used to transfer specific attributes from a template to copied primitives.  In this example, a sphere is use as a template with color attributes added to the sphere points.  A Particle SOP is then used to birth particles from the sphere points.
Next, a Copy SOP does two things:
It copies geometry to the particles.
It transfers the color attribute from the source sphere points to the geometry whose position is based on the particles.
Play the animation to see the effects.
